TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IServerWebConfig

Docs.summary: Creates a Web.config file for a SOAP-enabled COM+ application and adds component entries to the file for COM interfaces being published in the application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IServerWebConfig> interface is implemented only by the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ServerWebConfig> class and is only used within the .NET Framework infrastructure. Rather than implementing this interface or instantiating an <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IServerWebConfig> interface object, use the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.Publish> class, which implements the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IComSoapPublisher> interface.
<xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.IServerWebConfig> is used internally by the .NET Framework. You do not need to use it directly in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddElement (string FilePath, string AssemblyName, string TypeName, string ProgId, string Mode, out string Error);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddElement(string FilePath, string AssemblyName, string TypeName, string ProgId, string Mode, [out] string& Error) cil managed
Public Sub AddElement (FilePath As String, AssemblyName As String, TypeName As String, ProgId As String, Mode As String, ByRef Error As String)

public: void AddElement(System::String ^ FilePath, System::String ^ AssemblyName, System::String ^ TypeName, System::String ^ ProgId, System::String ^ Mode, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::String ^ % Error);
abstract member AddElement : string * string * string * string * string * -> unit
MemberSignature.Usage: iServerWebConfig.AddElement (FilePath, AssemblyName, TypeName, ProgId, Mode, Error)

Docs.param: The path for the existing Web.config file.
The name of the assembly that contains the type being added.
The name of the type being added.
The programmatic identifier for the type being added.
A string constant that corresponds to the name of a member from the enumeration, which indicates how a well-known object is activated.
A string to which an error message can be written.
Docs.summary: Adds XML elements to a Web.config file for a COM interface being published in a SOAP-enabled COM+ application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ServerWebConfig.AddElement%2A> method for implementation details. However, you do not need to call `AddElement` method directly.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Create (string FilePath, string FileRootName, out string Error);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Create(string FilePath, string FileRootName, [out] string& Error) cil managed
Public Sub Create (FilePath As String, FileRootName As String, ByRef Error As String)
public: void Create(System::String ^ FilePath, System::String ^ FileRootName, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::String ^ % Error);
abstract member Create : string * string * -> unit

Docs.param: The folder in which to create the configuration file.
The string value to which a config extension can be added (for example, Web for Web.config).
A string to which an error message can be written.
Docs.summary: Creates a Web.config file for a SOAP-enabled COM+ application so that the file is ready to have XML elements added for COM interfaces being published.

remarks.format: ## Remarks See the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.Internal.ServerWebConfig.Create%2A> method for implementation details. However, you do not need to call `Create` directly.
